<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;margin-top:15px;margin-bottom:15px;line-height:22px;">

</p>

<th class="clear" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400">

<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Joe Biden has selected Sen. Kamala Harris as his running mate. She'll become the first Black woman on a major party presidential ticket in U.S. history. A quick bio:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>She served as California's attorney general from 2011–2016.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2016, Harris became the first South Asian American elected to the Senate.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>You might remember her for turning up the heat on Mark Zuckerberg during 2018's Cambridge Analytica hearings.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One more interesting fact before we dive in: According to Ben Jacobs, this is the first Democratic ticket since 1984 that will not have someone with an Ivy League degree. </p>
</td>

</th>
</tr>
</table>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/11/experts-fear-russia-cut-corners-recently-approved-covid-vaccine?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Russia Takes the Lead (Maybe)
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Russia's coronavirus vaccine " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDUwL3J1c3NpYV9zX2Nvcm9uYXZpcnVzX3ZhY2NpbmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Vodka and Tolstoy might be losing their status as Russia’s most esteemed exports. Yesterday, President Vladimir Putin announced his government has approved the <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/08/11/901270401/skepticism-greets-putins-announcement-of-russian-coronavirus-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first COVID-19 vaccine</a>, which will be ready for the public by January. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And yes, they named it Sputnik-V after the pioneering satellite. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Not so fast </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many health officials are worried Russia cut corners. Moscow-based Gamaleya Institute, which developed the vaccine, hasn’t actually finished human trials. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The vaccine starts Phase 3 today. That usually involves thousands of participants and a placebo and is typically the final test before approval. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An association representing clinical trials organizations asked Russia’s health agency on Monday to delay approval until Phase 3 is complete. Nevertheless, Putin was confident enough to inoculate his own daughter, and yesterday Russia’s national health minister <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/11/world/europe/russia-coronavirus-vaccine-approval.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> teachers and medical workers will start receiving the vaccine this month. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Russian officials <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/11/europe/russia-coronavirus-vaccine-putin-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told CNN</a> they’ve already received applications for 1+ billion doses from 20 countries. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The great vaccine race</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of the 30+ vaccines in human trials, eight have reached Phase 3. Last month, Russian drugmaker R-Pharm struck a deal to license one of them, co-developed by AstraZeneca and Oxford. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The U.S. also has a $1.2 billion licensing deal with AstraZeneca for 300 million doses if it moves it to production.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Yesterday, the U.S. also agreed to buy </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/moderna-vaccine-coronavirus-trump-690017d1-6348-4312-bc61-06d8b783b7ca.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">100 million doses</a></span><span> of Moderna's potential vaccine. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Asked about Russia’s news, U.S. HHS Secretary Alex Azar said, "The point is not to be first...the point is to have a vaccine that is safe and effective.” But that hasn’t stopped countries from jockeying to secure first place. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last month, the U.S., the UK, and Canada <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2020/07/16/russia-accused-hacking-covid-19-vaccine-trials-us-canada-uk/5450010002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called out</a> Russian intelligence services for hacking researchers and companies working on COVID-19 vaccines (allegations Russia denies). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Rushing to approve a faulty vaccine could undermine public trust. In a <a href="https://news.gallup.com/poll/317018/one-three-americans-not-covid-vaccine.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recent survey</a>, over one-third of U.S. adults said they wouldn’t get one, even if it’s FDA-approved and free. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here: </strong>A lack of understanding about COVID-19's effects on the immune system makes finding a vaccine a daunting task. The Atlantic’s Ed Yong <a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2020/08/covid-19-immunity-is-the-pandemics-central-mystery/614956/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dives into COVID-19 and immunology</a>.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/11/big-ten-pac12-postpone-2020-football-season?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Ten, Pac-12 Call Delay of Game
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="ANN ARBOR, MI - OCTOBER 17:  General view as the Michigan Wolverines kic..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDUxL21pY2hpZ2FuX3N0YXRlX3ZfbWljaGlnYW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Christian Petersen/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the NCAA’s Big Ten and Pac-12 conferences <a href="https://www.espn.com/college-football/story/_/id/29640222/sources-big-ten-pulls-plug-fall-football-season?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> none of their sports teams, including football, will play this fall over health concerns. They’re hoping to resume play in the spring. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The announcement further deepens what the NYT calls the "greatest crisis in the history of college athletics."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Conferences have been squabbling, not just with one another but among themselves, about whether to play this season. The CDC’s recommendations against close contact discourage it, but many universities rely on football revenues to fund all their other sports. Wisconsin, a Big Ten school, at one point <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/11/sports/ncaafootball/big-ten-postpones-football-season.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suggested</a> it could lose up to $100 million without a football season. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>One element that makes those squabbles even squabblier: the NCAA’s decentralized structure, in which each of the conferences can make executive decisions.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Recently, the fall college football season <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/college-sports-24-hours-of-political-football-11597143601?mod=hp_lead_pos10&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">became</a> a political you-know-what. Republicans such as President Trump and senators from states like Georgia and Nebraska, which are to college football what Lockhart, TX, is to barbecue, joined frustrated players’ and coaches' calls to play the fall season. </p>

INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/11/international-news-roundup-oil-spill-contested-elections-belarus-covid19-nz?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
From the World News Desk
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="Oil spill of Mauritius " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDQ3L29pbF9zcGlsbF9vZl9tYXVyaXRpdXMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Mauritius:</strong> Thousands of volunteers are trying to avert the worst of an <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/mauritius-races-contain-oil-spill-grounded-ship-protect-coastline-n1236294?cid=sm_npd_nn_tw_ma&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ecological disaster</a> following a massive oil spill by a grounded Japanese tanker. The ship is expected to break apart any moment, potentially sending another 2,000 metric tons of petroleum products into the African island’s pristine waters.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hong Kong:</strong> Following the passage of a new security law in China, authorities are <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/08/11/901220054/beijing-attempts-to-remake-hong-kong-in-its-image-as-national-security-law-takes?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">targeting</a> members of Hong Kong’s civil society and education system. On Monday, media mogul Jimmy Lai, who runs the pro-democracy paper Apple Daily, was arrested on charges of "colluding with foreign forces." Hong Kong is at the center of deteriorating U.S.-China relations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Belarus: </strong>Aleksandr Lukashenko won his sixth consecutive term as president, but following allegations of a rigged election, opposition leader Svetlana Tsikhanouskaya <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/belarusian-election-fallout-opposition-leader-flees-country-amid-protests-n1236355?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fled</a> to neighboring Lithuania. Protests over Lukashenko's handling of COVID-19, the economy, and human rights came to a head Sunday, when the government <a href="https://www.wired.com/story/belarus-internet-outage-election/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">imposed</a> a connectivity blackout on Belarus’s 9.5 million residents.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">New Zealand: </strong>After 102 days without any new domestic cases, New Zealand <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/08/11/901304243/new-zealand-on-alert-after-4-cases-of-covid-19-emerge-from-an-unknown-source?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">registered</a> four new COVID-19 patients yesterday. The government is still figuring out the source and has reinstated lockdown measures in Auckland.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You betcha, we’re back again to talk about <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N2992.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23591364.279277368;dc_trk_aid=473347974;dc_trk_cid=100857211;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vanguard Digital Advisor™</a>. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/11/gm-cfo-suryadevara-departs-fintech-stripe?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Go West, Young Finance Whiz
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Dhivya Suryadevara" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDQ4L2RoaXZ5YV9zdXJ5YWRldmFyYS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Steve Fecht, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Dhivya_Suryadevara.jpg" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Dhivya Suryadevara</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 4.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, GM said its CFO Dhivya Suryadevara <a href="https://apnews.com/37922ba0adf3e87d8013f56089edfad6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will trade</a> brakes and shocks for lightweight jackets and fixies—she’s departing the iconic automaker for Bay Area fintech juggernaut Stripe. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For Stripe: </strong>It’s a W...for Wunderkind. At 39, Suryadevara became GM’s first female finance chief ever. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Stripe, which provides payment processing software to businesses, has finances that seem enjoyable to manage. In April, it </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-11/gm-s-chief-financial-officer-resigns-to-join-fintech-startup?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised</a></span><span> $600 million at a $36 billion valuation from Silicon Valley heavyweights such as Sequoia Capital. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For GM:</strong> It’s an L...for Large loss. Brain drain is a major issue for the traditional Detroit auto giants, especially with Tesla’s market cap doubling every time you blink. GM has been struggling more generally, with last year’s worker strike and *gestures at everything* in 2020. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company hemorrhaged $9 billion in Q2 when factories shut down because of the pandemic. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Stripe has been <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/cad1b958-d7fa-409c-b03e-7ecded63aed9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bulking up</a> its leadership team with poaches from Amazon Web Services and now GM, fueling IPO rumors. But the company is playing coy about a future public offering.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F08%2F11%2Fgm-cfo-suryadevara-departs-fintech-stripe" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/11/ev-startup-lucids-new-model-clocks-record-range?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Is No Lucid Dream
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Lucid Air" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDQ5L2x1Y2lkX2Fpci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Lucid</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Electric vehicle startup Lucid’s new sedan, the Lucid Air, <a href="https://www.axios.com/lucid-motors-electric-driving-range-benchmark-29128cb6-48dd-4947-8477-b854a42ec84c.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is very real</a>. And it can go the distance—independent testing showed the Air can travel 517 miles on a single charge, crowning it one of the longest-range EVs on the market. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That means you could drive from NYC to Philadelphia, realize you forgot your wallet, go back to get it, drive back to Philly, realize you’re in love with your best friend, drive back to NYC to tearfully reunite with him on the Brooklyn Bridge, then head to a cottage upstate...without having to recharge your EV. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s about 115 miles farther than Tesla’s highest-range vehicle, the Model S. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How he built this: </strong>CEO and CTO Peter Rawlinson (a former Tesla employee) <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/11/lucid-makes-a-run-for-tesla-with-luxury-ev-sedan-with-a-record-517-miles-of-range-per-charge.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">credited</a> Lucid’s high-tech motors, which were created in-house, for the best-in-class range. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Lucid will unveil the final version of the Air on Sept. 9, and production is set to start next year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>Tesla announced a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/11/tesla-announces-five-for-one-stock-split.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">five-for-one stock split</a>, which doesn't materially change anything about the company's valuation but does make its stock more affordable to individual investors. Shares gained ~7% after hours. </p>

href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/11/experts-fear-russia-cut-corners-recently-approved-covid-vaccine?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nRussia Takes the Lead (Maybe)\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Russia's coronavirus vaccine \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDUwL3J1c3NpYV9zX2Nvcm9uYXZpcnVzX3ZhY2NpbmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eVodka and Tolstoy might be losing their status as Russia’s most esteemed exports. Yesterday, President Vladimir Putin announced his government has approved the \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/08/11/901270401/skepticism-greets-putins-announcement-of-russian-coronavirus-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst COVID-19 vaccine\u003c/a\u003e, which will be ready for the public by January. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd yes, they named it Sputnik-V after the pioneering satellite. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNot so fast \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany health officials are worried Russia cut corners. Moscow-based Gamaleya Institute, which developed the vaccine, hasn’t actually finished human trials. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe vaccine starts Phase 3 today. That usually involves thousands of participants and a placebo and is typically the final test before approval. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAn association representing clinical trials organizations asked Russia’s health agency on Monday to delay approval until Phase 3 is complete. Nevertheless, Putin was confident enough to inoculate his own daughter, and yesterday Russia’s national health minister \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/11/world/europe/russia-coronavirus-vaccine-approval.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e teachers and medical workers will start receiving the vaccine this month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRussian officials \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/11/europe/russia-coronavirus-vaccine-putin-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold CNN\u003c/a\u003e they’ve already received applications for 1+ billion doses from 20 countries. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe great vaccine race\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf the 30+ vaccines in human trials, eight have reached Phase 3. Last month, Russian drugmaker R-Pharm struck a deal to license one of them, co-developed by AstraZeneca and Oxford. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. also has a $1.2 billion licensing deal with AstraZeneca for 300 million doses if it moves it to production.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, the U.S. also agreed to buy \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/moderna-vaccine-coronavirus-trump-690017d1-6348-4312-bc61-06d8b783b7ca.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e100 million doses\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of Moderna's potential vaccine. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAsked about Russia’s news, U.S. HHS Secretary Alex Azar said, \"The point is not to be first...the point is to have a vaccine that is safe and effective.” But that hasn’t stopped countries from jockeying to secure first place. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast month, the U.S., the UK, and Canada \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2020/07/16/russia-accused-hacking-covid-19-vaccine-trials-us-canada-uk/5450010002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled out\u003c/a\u003e Russian intelligence services for hacking researchers and companies working on COVID-19 vaccines (allegations Russia denies). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eRushing to approve a faulty vaccine could undermine public trust. In a \u003ca href=\"https://news.gallup.com/poll/317018/one-three-americans-not-covid-vaccine.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecent survey\u003c/a\u003e, over one-third of U.S. adults said they wouldn’t get one, even if it’s FDA-approved and free. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here: \u003c/strong\u003eA lack of understanding about COVID-19's effects on the immune system makes finding a vaccine a daunting task. The Atlantic’s Ed Yong \u003ca href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2020/08/covid-19-immunity-is-the-pandemics-central-mystery/614956/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edives into COVID-19 and immunology\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the NCAA’s Big Ten and Pac-12 conferences \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/college-football/story/_/id/29640222/sources-big-ten-pulls-plug-fall-football-season?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e none of their sports teams, including football, will play this fall over health concerns. They’re hoping to resume play in the spring. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe announcement further deepens what the NYT calls the \"greatest crisis in the history of college athletics.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eConferences have been squabbling, not just with one another but among themselves, about whether to play this season. The CDC’s recommendations against close contact discourage it, but many universities rely on football revenues to fund all their other sports. Wisconsin, a Big Ten school, at one point \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/11/sports/ncaafootball/big-ten-postpones-football-season.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuggested\u003c/a\u003e it could lose up to $100 million without a football season. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOne element that makes those squabbles even squabblier: the NCAA’s decentralized structure, in which each of the conferences can make executive decisions.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Recently, the fall college football season \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/college-sports-24-hours-of-political-football-11597143601?mod=hp_lead_pos10\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebecame\u003c/a\u003e a political you-know-what. Republicans such as President Trump and senators from states like Georgia and Nebraska, which are to college football what Lockhart, TX, is to barbecue, joined frustrated players’ and coaches' calls to play the fall season. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, GM said its CFO Dhivya Suryadevara \u003ca Stripe. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor Stripe: \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s a W...for Wunderkind. At 39, Suryadevara became GM’s first female finance chief ever. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eStripe, which provides payment processing software to businesses, has finances that seem enjoyable to manage. In April, it \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-11/gm-s-chief-financial-officer-resigns-to-join-fintech-startup?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e $600 million at a $36 billion valuation from Silicon Valley heavyweights such as Sequoia Capital. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor GM:\u003c/strong\u003e It’s an L...for Large loss. Brain drain is a major issue for the traditional Detroit auto giants, especially with Tesla’s market cap doubling every time you blink. GM has been struggling more generally, with last year’s worker strike and *gestures at everything* in 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company hemorrhaged $9 billion in Q2 when factories shut down because of the pandemic. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eStripe has been \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/cad1b958-d7fa-409c-b03e-7ecded63aed9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebulking up\u003c/a\u003e its leadership team with poaches from Amazon Web Services and now GM, fueling IPO rumors. And it can go the distance—independent testing showed the Air can travel 517 miles on a single charge, crowning it one of the longest-range EVs on the market. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat means you could drive from NYC to Philadelphia, realize you forgot your wallet, go back to get it, drive back to Philly, realize you’re in love with your best friend, drive back to NYC to tearfully reunite with him on the Brooklyn Bridge, then head to a cottage upstate...without having to recharge your EV. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s about 115 miles farther than Tesla’s highest-range vehicle, the Model S. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow he built this: \u003c/strong\u003eCEO and CTO Peter Rawlinson (a former Tesla employee) \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/11/lucid-makes-a-run-for-tesla-with-luxury-ev-sedan-with-a-record-517-miles-of-range-per-charge.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecredited\u003c/a\u003e Lucid’s high-tech motors, which were created in-house, for the best-in-class range. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eLucid will unveil the final version of the Air on Sept. 9, and production is set to start next year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eTesla announced a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/11/tesla-announces-five-for-one-stock-split.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efive-for-one stock split\u003c/a\u003e, which doesn't materially change anything about the company's valuation but does make its stock more affordable to individual investors.
